code: @Manual{,   title = {cartogram: Create Cartograms with R},   author = {Sebastian Jeworutzki},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.4.0,     https://sjewo.github.io/cartogram/},   url = {https://github.com/sjewo/cartogram}, }

title: Create Cartograms with R
text: Construct continuous area cartogram rubber sheet distortion algorithm (Dougenik et al. 1985), non-contiguous Area Cartograms (Olson 1976), non-overlapping Circles Cartogram (Dorling el al. 1996) R.

title: Create Cartograms with R
text: can install cartogram package CRAN follows: upgrade latest development version cartogram, install package devtools run following command:

title: Create Cartograms with R
code: library(cartogram) library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.11.0, GDAL 3.5.3, PROJ 9.1.0; sf_use_s2() is TRUE library(tmap)  data("World")  # keep only the african continent afr <- World[World$continent == "Africa", ]  # project the map afr <- st_transform(afr, 3395)  # construct cartogram afr_cont <- cartogram_cont(afr, "pop_est", itermax = 5)  # plot it tm_shape(afr_cont) + tm_polygons("pop_est", style = "jenks") +   tm_layout(frame = FALSE, legend.position = c("left", "bottom"))

title: Create Cartograms with R
text: Many thanks @rCarto @neocarto contributing code!
code: # construct cartogram afr_ncont <- cartogram_ncont(afr, "pop_est")  # plot it tm_shape(afr) + tm_borders() +   tm_shape(afr_ncont) + tm_polygons("pop_est", style = "jenks") +   tm_layout(frame = FALSE, legend.position = c("left", "bottom"))

title: Create Cartograms with R
text: Many thanks @rCarto contributing code!
code: # construct cartogram afr_dorling <- cartogram_dorling(afr, "pop_est")  # plot it tm_shape(afr) + tm_borders() +   tm_shape(afr_dorling) + tm_polygons("pop_est", style = "jenks") +   tm_layout(frame = FALSE, legend.position = c("left", "bottom"))

title: Create Cartograms with R
text: Dorling, D. (1996). Area Cartograms: Use Creation. Concepts Techniques Modern Geography (CATMOG), 59. Dougenik, J. ., Chrisman, N. R., & Niemeyer, D. R. (1985). Algorithm Construct Continuous Area Cartograms. Professional Geographer, 37(1), 75-81. Olson, J. M. (1976), Noncontiguous Area Cartograms. Professional Geographer, 28: 371–380. doi:10.1111/j.0033-0124.1976.00371.x

title: Calculate Contiguous Cartogram Boundaries — cartogram
text: function renamed: Please use cartogram_cont() instead cartogram().

title: Calculate Contiguous Cartogram Boundaries — cartogram
text: shp SpatialPolygonDataFrame sf object ... Arguments passed cartogram_cont weight Name weighting variable x itermax Maximum iterations cartogram transformation, maxSizeError ist reached maxSizeError Stop meanSizeError smaller maxSizeError prepare Weighting values adjusted reach convergence much earlier. Possible methods "adjust", adjust values restrict mass vector quantiles defined threshold 1-threshold (default), "remove", remove features values lower quantile threshold, "none", adjust weighting values threshold "auto" threshold value 0 1. “auto”, value 0.05 , proportion zeros weight greater 0.05, value adjusted accordingly. verbose print meanSizeError iteration n_cpu Number cores use. Defaults "respect_future_plan". Available options : * "respect_future_plan" - default, function run single core, unless user specifies number cores using plan (e.g. `future::plan(future::multisession, workers = 4)`) running `cartogram_cont` function. * "auto" - Use except available cores (identified availableCores) except 1, keep system responsive. * `numeric` value - Use specified number cores. case `cartogram_cont` use set specified number cores internally `future::plan(future::multisession, workers = n_cpu)` revert back switching plan back whichever plan might set user. 1 core set, function require `future` `future.apply` run single core. show_progress `logical` value. TRUE, show progress bar. Defaults TRUE.

what: Checks if a package is installed and *informs* the user if not — cartogram_assert_package
title: Checks if a package is installed and *informs* the user if not — cartogram_assert_package
text: wrapper around [rlang::check_installed]; instead erroring check fails returns `FALSE`. However, unlike [rlang::is_installed], emits message user.

title: Checks if a package is installed and *informs* the user if not — cartogram_assert_package
Checks if a package is installed and *informs* the user if not — cartogram_assert_package
text: ... Arguments passed rlang::check_installed pkg package names. Can include version requirements, e.g. "pkg (>= 1.0.0)". version Minimum versions pkg. supplied, must length pkg. NA elements stand versions. compare character vector comparison operators use version. supplied, must length version. NULL, >= used default elements. NA elements compare also set >= default. reason Optional string indicating pkg needed. Appears error messages (non-interactive) user prompts (interactive). action optional function taking pkg ... arguments. called check_installed() user chooses update outdated packages. function passed missing outdated packages character vector names. call execution environment currently running function, e.g. caller_env(). function mentioned error messages source error. See call argument abort() information.

title: Calculate Contiguous Cartogram Boundaries — cartogram_cont
text: Construct continuous area cartogram rubber sheet distortion algorithm (Dougenik et al. 1985)

title: Calculate Contiguous Cartogram Boundaries — cartogram_cont
code: cartogram_cont(   x,   weight,   itermax = 15,   maxSizeError = 1.0001,   prepare = "adjust",   threshold = "auto",   verbose = FALSE,   n_cpu = "respect_future_plan",   show_progress = TRUE )  # S3 method for class 'SpatialPolygonsDataFrame' cartogram_cont(   x,   weight,   itermax = 15,   maxSizeError = 1.0001,   prepare = "adjust",   threshold = "auto",   verbose = FALSE,   n_cpu = "respect_future_plan",   show_progress = TRUE )  # S3 method for class 'sf' cartogram_cont(   x,   weight,   itermax = 15,   maxSizeError = 1.0001,   prepare = "adjust",   threshold = "auto",   verbose = FALSE,   n_cpu = "respect_future_plan",   show_progress = TRUE )

title: Calculate Contiguous Cartogram Boundaries — cartogram_cont
text: x polygon multiplogyon sf object weight Name weighting variable x itermax Maximum iterations cartogram transformation, maxSizeError ist reached maxSizeError Stop meanSizeError smaller maxSizeError prepare Weighting values adjusted reach convergence much earlier. Possible methods "adjust", adjust values restrict mass vector quantiles defined threshold 1-threshold (default), "remove", remove features values lower quantile threshold, "none", adjust weighting values threshold "auto" threshold value 0 1. “auto”, value 0.05 , proportion zeros weight greater 0.05, value adjusted accordingly. verbose print meanSizeError iteration n_cpu Number cores use. Defaults "respect_future_plan". Available options : * "respect_future_plan" - default, function run single core, unless user specifies number cores using plan (e.g. `future::plan(future::multisession, workers = 4)`) running `cartogram_cont` function. * "auto" - Use except available cores (identified availableCores) except 1, keep system responsive. * `numeric` value - Use specified number cores. case `cartogram_cont` use set specified number cores internally `future::plan(future::multisession, workers = n_cpu)` revert back switching plan back whichever plan might set user. 1 core set, function require `future` `future.apply` run single core. show_progress `logical` value. TRUE, show progress bar. Defaults TRUE.

title: Calculate Non-Overlapping Circles Cartogram — cartogram_dorling
text: Construct cartogram represents geographic region non-overlapping circles (Dorling 1996).

title: Calculate Non-Overlapping Circles Cartogram — cartogram_dorling
code: cartogram_dorling(x, weight, k = 5, m_weight = 1, itermax = 1000)  # S3 method for class 'sf' cartogram_dorling(x, weight, k = 5, m_weight = 1, itermax = 1000)  # S3 method for class 'SpatialPolygonsDataFrame' cartogram_dorling(x, weight, k = 5, m_weight = 1, itermax = 1000)

title: Calculate Non-Overlapping Circles Cartogram — cartogram_dorling
text: x polygon multiplogyon sf object weight Name weighting variable x k Share bounding box x filled larger circle m_weight Circles' movements weights. optional vector numeric weights (0 1 inclusive) apply distance circle moves pair-repulsion. weight 0 prevents movement. weight 1 gives default movement distance. single value can supplied uniform weights. vector length less number circles silently extended repeating final value. values outside range [0, 1] clamped 0 1. itermax Maximum iterations cartogram transformation.

title: Calculate Non-Overlapping Circles Cartogram — cartogram_dorling
text: Non overlaping proportional circles class x.

title: Calculate Non-Overlapping Circles Cartogram — cartogram_dorling
text: Dorling, D. (1996). Area Cartograms: Use Creation. Concepts Techniques Modern Geography (CATMOG), 59.

title: Calculate Non-Overlapping Circles Cartogram — cartogram_dorling
code: library(sf) library(cartogram)  nc = st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package="sf"), quiet = TRUE)  # transform to NAD83 / UTM zone 16N nc_utm <- st_transform(nc, 26916)  # Create cartogram nc_utm_carto <- cartogram_dorling(nc_utm, weight = "BIR74")  # Plot  par(mfrow=c(2,1)) plot(nc[,"BIR74"], main="original", key.pos = NULL, reset = FALSE) plot(nc_utm_carto[,"BIR74"], main="distorted", key.pos = NULL, reset = FALSE)

title: Calculate Non-Contiguous Cartogram Boundaries — cartogram_ncont
text: Construct non-contiguous area cartogram (Olson 1976).

title: Calculate Non-Contiguous Cartogram Boundaries — cartogram_ncont
code: cartogram_ncont(   x,   weight,   k = 1,   inplace = TRUE,   n_cpu = "respect_future_plan",   show_progress = TRUE )  # S3 method for class 'SpatialPolygonsDataFrame' cartogram_ncont(   x,   weight,   k = 1,   inplace = TRUE,   n_cpu = "respect_future_plan",   show_progress = TRUE )  # S3 method for class 'sf' cartogram_ncont(   x,   weight,   k = 1,   inplace = TRUE,   n_cpu = "respect_future_plan",   show_progress = TRUE )

title: Calculate Non-Contiguous Cartogram Boundaries — cartogram_ncont
text: x polygon multiplogyon sf object weight Name weighting variable x k Factor expansion unit greater value inplace TRUE, polygon modified original place, FALSE multi-polygons centered initial centroid n_cpu Number cores use. Defaults "respect_future_plan". Available options : * "respect_future_plan" - default, function run single core, unless user specifies number cores using plan (e.g. `future::plan(future::multisession, workers = 4)`) running `cartogram_ncont` function. * "auto" - Use except available cores (identified availableCores) except 1, keep system responsive. * `numeric` value - Use specified number cores. case `cartogram_ncont` use set specified number cores internally `future::plan(future::multisession, workers = n_cpu)` revert back switching plan back whichever plan might set user. 1 core set, function require `future` `future.apply` run single core. show_progress `logical` value. TRUE, show progress bar. Defaults TRUE.

TRUE, show progress bar. Defaults TRUE.

title: cartogram 0.4.0
text: new n_cpu option cartogram_cont() cartogram_ncont(), distortion can calculated multiple CPU cores. default value treshold option cartogram_cont() automatically increased weighting variable contains lot zeros. New testthat tests

title: cartogram 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-05-26 Remove sp, rgdal maptools examples suggestions. cartogram_cont() new parameter verbose = FALSE hide print size error iteration.

title: cartogram 0.2.2
text: CRAN release: 2020-08-26 Fix geometry replacement cartogram_ncont

title: cartogram 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-12-07 Migrated functions sf, fixed problems multipolygons. cartogram functions won’t accept features longitude/latitude coordinates anymore.

title: cartogram 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2018-12-01 Update sf code. Thanks @Nowosad speeding things !
